data.title: Movie Box Office Figures
data.text: Weekly movie stats: http://www.the-numbers.com http://www.boxofficemojo.com http://movies.yahoo.com/boxoffice/latest/rank.html ------------ NOTE: Some figures below are THEATRICAL RENTALS, not BOX OFFICE GROSS figures. Theatrical Rentals should always have their column labeled as such. "Theatrical Rentals" are the actual amount paid to the theatrical distributor (most studios have their own distribution arm) by theaters. This is a smaller figure than the gross box office ticket sales. To obtain approximate gross domestic sales from Rental figure, multiply rental by 2.18 DEMONSTRATION, based on data from actual 1969 rental table combined with data from actual 1969 gross ticket sales table (then divide gross by rental to obtain rental-to-gross multiplier): Title Rental Gross Multiply Rental by ? for Gross Butch Cassidy & the Sundance Kid $45,953,000 $102,308,900 2.23 The Love Bug 23,150,000 50,576,808 2.18 Midnight Cowboy 20,499,000 44,785,053 2.18 Easy Rider 19,100,000 41,728,598 2.18 Hello, Dolly 15,200,000 33,208,099 2.18 Bob & Carrol & Ted & Alice 14,600,000 31,897,253 2.18 Paint Your Wagon 14,500,000 31,678,778 2.18 True Grit 14,250,000 31,132,592 2.18 Cactus Flower 11,850,000 25,889,208 2.18 Goodbye, Columbus 10,500,000 22,939,805 2.18 On Her Majesty's Secret Service 9,117,000 22,800,000 2.50 I Am Curious 8,500,000 18,570,318 2.18 Z 7,100,000 15,511,678 2.18 Winning 6,703,000 14,644,335 2.18 The Sterile Cuckoo 6,400,000 13,982,357 2.18 ----------------------------------------------------------- Source: Susan Sackett, The Hollywood Reporter Book of Box Office Hits, Billboard Publications: New York City (1990).
